question: 針医
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>Needle</kanji> <kanji>medicine</kanji> is when you stick needles into people to cure them. This is done via an <vocabulary>acupuncturist</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This word uses the kun'yomi reading for <ja>針</ja> and the on'yomi reading for <ja>医</ja>. You haven't learned this reading for <ja>針</ja> yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

If you do <vocabulary>acupuncture</vocabulary> and stick a bunch of needles in your back it's going to look really <reading>hairy</reading> (<ja>はり</ja>). Needles look just like metal hairs when they're coming out of someone. Just picture hairy little needles all over your body and you'll never forget this reading!
